stories.text:
In our case where I'm supporting a multitenant k8s environment for large company... Where each tenant is different team who are hosting web apps for their business units. We have traditionally abstracted logging monitoring as a service to our tennants so they didn't have to implement these cross cutting concerns. Now with authentication we would have done your traditional SSO (Oam, siteminder, ping) as centrallized on platform layer....

But as we are seeing more and more apps implement their own openidc in their own web frameworks... The tradition http header based remote_user approach is looked down upon.

But as a platform I see everyone again reinventing the wheel... And these are digression from app logic... Also I noticed there are few open-source openidc proxy or an claim based authorization solution..

But I wonder if it still makes sense to have SSO/Authn layer at platform anymore or it's more modern (better design) to let apps do it on their own?
